00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup FLASH_Private_Define FLASH private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 
00046 /* Delay definition                                                                                         */
00047 #define FLASH_TIMEOUT                 (0x000FFFFF)
00048 
00049 /* FLASH OCMR                                                                                               */
00050 #define FLASH_CMD_STADNBY             (0x00000000)
00051 #define FLASH_CMD_PROGRAM             (0x00000004)
00052 #define FLASH_CMD_PAGEERASE           (0x00000008)
00053 #define FLASH_CMD_MASSERASE           (0x0000000A)
00054 
00055 /* FLASH OPCR                                                                                               */
00056 #define FLASH_READY                   (0x6UL << 1)
00057 #define FLASH_SEND_MAIN               (0x00000014)
00058 
00059 /* FLASH CFCR                                                                                               */
00060 #define CFCR_WAIT_MASK                (0xFFFFFFF8)
00061 
00062 #if (LIBCFG_FMC_PREFETCH)
00063 #define FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_ON          (0x00000010)
00064 #define FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_OFF         (0xFFFFFFEF)
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 #if (LIBCFG_FMC_BRANCHCACHE)
00068 #define FLASH_BRANCHCACHE_ON          (0x00001000)
00069 #define FLASH_BRANCHCACHE_OFF         (0xFFFFEFFF)
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #define FLASH_CFCR_MASK                               (0xFFFFEFE8)
00073 #define FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_AND_BRANCHCACHE_ON          (0x00001010)
00074 #define FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_AND_BRANCHCACHE_OFF         (0xFFFFEFEF)
00075 
00076 /**
00077   * @}
00078   */
00079 
00080 /* Private macro -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00081 /** @defgroup FLASH_Private_Macro FLASH private macros
00082   * @{
00083   */
00084 
00085 #if (LIBCFG_FMC_PREFETCH)
00086 /**
00087  * @brief Check parameter of the FLASH wait state.
00088  */
00089 #if (LIBCFG_FMC_WAIT_STATE_2)
00090 #define IS_WAIT_STATE2(x)   (x == FLASH_WAITSTATE_2)
00091 #else
00092 #define IS_WAIT_STATE2(x)   (0)
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 #define IS_FLASH_WAITSTATE(WAIT)      ((WAIT == FLASH_WAITSTATE_0) || \
00096                                        (WAIT == FLASH_WAITSTATE_1) || \
00097                                        (IS_WAIT_STATE2(WAIT)))
00098 #endif
00099 /**
00100  * @brief Check parameter of the FLASH vector mapping.
00101  */
00102 #define IS_FLASH_VECTOR_MODE(MODE)    ((MODE == FLASH_BOOT_LOADER) || \
00103                                        (MODE == FLASH_BOOT_MAIN))
00104 /**
00105  * @brief Check parameter of the FLASH address.
00106  */
00107 #define IS_FLASH_ADDRESS(ADDRESS)     (ADDRESS < 0x20000000)  /* Code 0.5GB Area                            */
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * @brief Check parameter of the FLASH interrupt status.
00111  */
00112 #define IS_FLASH_WC_FLAG(FLAG)        ((FLAG & 0x0000001F) != 0)
00113 
00114 /**
00115  * @brief Check parameter of the FLASH interrupt flag.
00116  */
00117 #define IS_FLASH_FLAG(FLAG)           ((FLAG & 0x0003001F) != 0)
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * @brief Check parameter of the FLASH interrupt.
00121  */
00122 #define IS_FLASH_INT(IT)              ((IT & 0x0000001F) != 0)
00123 
00124 /**
00125   * @}
00126   */
00127 
00128 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00129 /** @defgroup FLASH_Exported_Functions FLASH exported functions
00130   * @{
00131   */
00132 #if (LIBCFG_FMC_PREFETCH)
00133 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00134  * @brief Configure the FLASH wait state.
00135  * @param FLASH_WAITSTATE_n: Setting of FLASH wait state.
00136  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00137  *     @arg \ref FLASH_WAITSTATE_0 : zero wait state
00138  *     @arg \ref FLASH_WAITSTATE_1 : one wait state
00139  *     @arg \ref FLASH_WAITSTATE_2 : two wait state
00140  * @retval None
00141  ************************************************************************************************************/
00142 void FLASH_SetWaitState(u32 FLASH_WAITSTATE_n)
00143 {
00144   u32 uCFCR;
00145   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00146   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_WAITSTATE(FLASH_WAITSTATE_n));
00147 
00148   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00149      Before changing wait state, both Pre-fetch function and Branch Cache function must be disabled.
00150   */
00151   uCFCR = HT_FLASH->CFCR; /* Backup previous settings.                                                      */
00152 
00153   /* Disable Pre-fetch function and Branch Cache.                                                           */
00154   HT_FLASH->CFCR = uCFCR & FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_AND_BRANCHCACHE_OFF;
00155   /* Change wait state.                                                                                     */
00156   HT_FLASH->CFCR = (uCFCR & FLASH_CFCR_MASK) | FLASH_WAITSTATE_n;
00157   /* Restore previous settings.                                                                             */
00158   HT_FLASH->CFCR |= uCFCR & (FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_AND_BRANCHCACHE_ON);
00159 }
00160 
00161 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00162  * @brief Enable or Disable FLASH pre-fetch buffer.
00163  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE
00164  * @retval None
00165  ************************************************************************************************************/
00166 void FLASH_PrefetchBufferCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00167 {
00168   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00169   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00170 
00171   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00172   {
00173     HT_FLASH->CFCR |= FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_ON;
00174   }
00175   else
00176   {
00177     HT_FLASH->CFCR &= FLASH_PREFETCHBUF_OFF;
00178   }
00179 }
00180 #endif
00181 
00182 #if (LIBCFG_FMC_BRANCHCACHE)
00183 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00184  * @brief Enable or Disable FLASH branch cache.
00185  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE
00186  * @retval None
00187  ************************************************************************************************************/
00188 void FLASH_BranchCacheCmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00189 {
00190   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00191   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00192 
00193   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00194   {
00195     HT_FLASH->CFCR |= FLASH_BRANCHCACHE_ON;
00196   }
00197   else
00198   {
00199     HT_FLASH->CFCR &= FLASH_BRANCHCACHE_OFF;
00200   }
00201 }
00202 #endif
00203 
00204 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00205  * @brief Set vector remapping mode.
00206  * @param FLASH_BOOT_x: Booting mode.
00207  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00208  *     @arg \ref FLASH_BOOT_LOADER : Boot loader mode
00209  *     @arg \ref FLASH_BOOT_MAIN   : Main FLASH mode
00210  * @retval None
00211  ************************************************************************************************************/
00212 void FLASH_SetRemappingMode(FLASH_Vector FLASH_BOOT_x)
00213 {
00214   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00215   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_VECTOR_MODE(FLASH_BOOT_x));
00216 
00217   HT_FLASH->VMCR = FLASH_BOOT_x;
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00221  * @brief Erase a specific FLASH page.
00222  * @param PageAddress: Address of the erased page.
00223  * @retval FLASH_State
00224  *   - \ref FLASH_COMPLETE
00225  *   - \ref FLASH_TIME_OUT
00226  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_WRITE_PROTECTED
00227  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_ADDR_OUT_OF_RANGE
00228  * @note  HSI must keep turn on when doing the Flash operation (Erase/Program).
00229  ************************************************************************************************************/
00230 FLASH_State FLASH_ErasePage(u32 PageAddress)
00231 {
00232   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00233   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_ADDRESS(PageAddress));
00234 
00235   HT_FLASH->TADR = PageAddress;
00236   HT_FLASH->OCMR = FLASH_CMD_PAGEERASE;
00237 
00238   return FLASH_WaitForOperationEnd();
00239 }
00240 
00241 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00242  * @brief Erase FLASH Option Byte page.
00243  * @retval FLASH_State
00244  *   - \ref FLASH_COMPLETE
00245  *   - \ref FLASH_TIME_OUT
00246  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_WRITE_PROTECTED
00247  * @note  HSI must keep turn on when doing the Flash operation (Erase/Program).
00248  ************************************************************************************************************/
00249 FLASH_State FLASH_EraseOptionByte(void)
00250 {
00251   return FLASH_ErasePage(OPTION_BYTE_BASE);
00252 }
00253 
00254 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00255  * @brief Erase the entire FLASH.
00256  * @retval FLASH_State
00257  *   - \ref FLASH_COMPLETE
00258  *   - \ref FLASH_TIME_OUT
00259  * @note  HSI must keep turn on when doing the Flash operation (Erase/Program).
00260  ************************************************************************************************************/
00261 FLASH_State FLASH_MassErase(void)
00262 {
00263   HT_FLASH->OCMR = FLASH_CMD_MASSERASE;
00264 
00265   return FLASH_WaitForOperationEnd();
00266 }
00267 
00268 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00269  * @brief Program one word data.
00270  * @param Address: The specific FLASH address to be programmed.
00271  * @param Data: The specific FLASH data to be programmed.
00272  * @retval FLASH_State
00273  *   - \ref FLASH_COMPLETE
00274  *   - \ref FLASH_TIME_OUT
00275  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_WRITE_PROTECTED
00276  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_ADDR_OUT_OF_RANGE
00277  * @note  HSI must keep turn on when doing the Flash operation (Erase/Program).
00278  ************************************************************************************************************/
00279 FLASH_State FLASH_ProgramWordData(u32 Address, u32 Data)
00280 {
00281   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00282   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_ADDRESS(Address));
00283 
00284   HT_FLASH->TADR = Address;
00285   HT_FLASH->WRDR = Data;
00286   HT_FLASH->OCMR = FLASH_CMD_PROGRAM;
00287 
00288   return FLASH_WaitForOperationEnd();
00289 }
00290 
00291 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00292  * @brief Program FLASH Option Byte page.
00293  * @param Option: Struct pointer of Option Bytes.
00294  * @retval FLASH_State
00295  *   - \ref FLASH_COMPLETE
00296  * @note  HSI must keep turn on when doing the Flash operation (Erase/Program).
00297  ************************************************************************************************************/
00298 FLASH_State FLASH_ProgramOptionByte(FLASH_OptionByte *Option)
00299 {
00300   s32 i;
00301   u32 CP = ~(Option->MainSecurity | Option->OptionProtect << 1);
00302   u32 checksum = 0;
00303 
00304   for (i = 3; i >= 0; i--)
00305   {
00306     FLASH_ProgramWordData(OB_PP0 + i * 4, ~(Option->WriteProtect[i]));
00307     checksum += ~(Option->WriteProtect[i]);
00308   }
00309 
00310   FLASH_ProgramWordData(OB_CP, CP);
00311   checksum += CP;
00312 
00313   FLASH_ProgramWordData(OB_CHECKSUM, checksum);
00314 
00315   return FLASH_COMPLETE;
00316 }
00317 
00318 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00319  * @brief Return security status of the FLASH.
00320  * @param Option: Struct pointer of Option Bytes.
00321  * @retval None
00322  ************************************************************************************************************/
00323 void FLASH_GetOptionByteStatus(FLASH_OptionByte *Option)
00324 {
00325   s32 i;
00326 
00327   for (i = 3; i >= 0; i--)
00328   {
00329     Option->WriteProtect[i] = ~HT_FLASH->PPSR[i];
00330   }
00331 
00332   Option->MainSecurity = !(HT_FLASH->CPSR & 1);
00333   Option->OptionProtect = !((HT_FLASH->CPSR >> 1) & 1);
00334 }
00335 
00336 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00337  * @brief Enable or Disable the specific FLASH interrupts.
00338  * @param FLASH_INT_x: The specific FLASH interrupt.
00339  *   This parameter can be any combination (|) of the following values:
00340  *     @arg \ref FLASH_INT_ORFIEN
00341  *     @arg \ref FLASH_INT_ITADIEN
00342  *     @arg \ref FLASH_INT_OBEIEN
00343  *     @arg \ref FLASH_INT_IOCMIEN
00344  *     @arg \ref FLASH_INT_OREIEN
00345  *     @arg \ref FLASH_INT_ALL
00346  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE
00347  * @retval None
00348  ************************************************************************************************************/
00349 void FLASH_IntConfig(u32 FLASH_INT_x, ControlStatus Cmd)
00350 {
00351   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00352   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_INT(FLASH_INT_x));
00353   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00354 
00355   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00356   {
00357     HT_FLASH->OIER |= FLASH_INT_x;
00358   }
00359   else
00360   {
00361     HT_FLASH->OIER &= ~FLASH_INT_x;
00362   }
00363 }
00364 
00365 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00366  * @brief Return flag status of the FLASH interrupt.
00367  * @param FLASH_FLAG_x: Flag of the FLASH interrupt.
00368  *   This parameter can be any combination (|) of the following values:
00369  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_OREF
00370  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_IOCMF
00371  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_OBEF
00372  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_ITADF
00373  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_ORFF
00374  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_PPEF
00375  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_RORFF
00376  * @retval FlagStatus
00377  *   - \ref SET
00378  *   - \ref RESET
00379  ************************************************************************************************************/
00380 FlagStatus FLASH_GetIntStatus(u32 FLASH_FLAG_x)
00381 {
00382   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00383   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_FLAG(FLASH_FLAG_x));
00384 
00385   if ((HT_FLASH->OISR & FLASH_FLAG_x) != (u32)RESET)
00386   {
00387     return SET;
00388   }
00389   else
00390   {
00391     return RESET;
00392   }
00393 }
00394 
00395 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00396  * @brief Clear specific interrupt flags of FLASH.
00397  * @param FLASH_FLAG_x: interrupt flag of FLASH.
00398  *   This parameter can be any combination (|) of the following values:
00399  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_OREF
00400  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_IOCMF
00401  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_OBEF
00402  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_ITADF
00403  *     @arg \ref FLASH_FLAG_ORFF
00404  * @retval None
00405  ************************************************************************************************************/
00406 void FLASH_ClearIntFlag(u32 FLASH_FLAG_x)
00407 {
00408   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00409   Assert_Param(IS_FLASH_WC_FLAG(FLASH_FLAG_x));
00410 
00411   HT_FLASH->OISR = FLASH_FLAG_x;
00412 }
00413 
00414 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00415  * @brief Wait untill the FLASH operation has finished or time-out has occurred.
00416  * @retval FLASH_State
00417  *   - \ref FLASH_COMPLETE
00418  *   - \ref FLASH_TIME_OUT
00419  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_WRITE_PROTECTED
00420  *   - \ref FLASH_ERR_ADDR_OUT_OF_RANGE
00421  * @note  HSI must keep turn on when doing the Flash operation (Erase/Program).
00422  ************************************************************************************************************/
00423 FLASH_State FLASH_WaitForOperationEnd(void)
00424 {
00425   u32 Timeout = FLASH_TIMEOUT;
00426   u32 Status;
00427 
00428   HT_FLASH->OIER |= (FLASH_INT_ITADIEN);
00429   HT_FLASH->OPCR = FLASH_SEND_MAIN;
00430   #if (LIBCFG_FMC_CMD_READY_WAIT)
00431   __NOP();__NOP();__NOP();__NOP();
00432   #endif
00433 
00434   /* Waits till the FLASH operation has finished or time-out has occurred                                   */
00435   while (Timeout--)
00436   {
00437     if ((HT_FLASH->OPCR & FLASH_READY) == FLASH_READY)
00438     {
00439       break;
00440     }
00441   }
00442   Status = HT_FLASH->OISR;
00443   HT_FLASH->OISR &= ~(FLASH_INT_ITADIEN);
00444 
00445   if (Status & FLASH_FLAG_PPEF)
00446   {
00447     return FLASH_ERR_WRITE_PROTECTED;
00448   }
00449   if (Status & FLASH_FLAG_ITADF)
00450   {
00451     return FLASH_ERR_ADDR_OUT_OF_RANGE;
00452   }
00453   if (Timeout == 0)
00454   {
00455     return FLASH_TIME_OUT;
00456   }
00457 
00458   return FLASH_COMPLETE;
00459 }
